newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat higher on short covering.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat higher on short covering.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures were higher at the midsession as commercials covered their short positions in the March contract, traders said.

"What's going on is that most of the hedging up here has moved to the March contract, so the commercials -- who are short March for the most part -- are rolling out to May. In doing that, they've got to buy their way out of the March," a trader said.
Spring wheat was also buoyed by support from CBOT wheat, which gained on spillover strength from fund buying in the soy complex, traders said.
At 1112 CST, MGE spring wheat was 1/2 to four cents per bushel higher, with March up 1/2 cent at $3.92. May was up two cents at $3.73.
Traders said March was trailing the May at the midsession because of ideas that the March/May spread had closed out of line Wednesday.
"The spread settled at 20-1/2 cents (per bushel), but it's more like a 19-cent item," a broker said.
